title: Web-Scale Academic Name Disambiguation: the WhoIsWho Benchmark, Leaderboard, and Toolkit. (arXiv:2302.11848v2 [cs.IR] UPDATED)
abstract: Name disambiguation -- a fundamental problem in online academic systems -- is now facing greater challenges with the increasing growth of research papers. For example, on AMiner, an online academic search platform, about 10% of names own more than 100 authors. Such real-world challenging cases have not been effectively addressed by existing researches due to the small-scale or low-quality datasets that they have used. translated_title: Web-Scale学术名称消歧：WhoIsWho基准、排行榜和工具包
translated_abstract: 名称消歧是在线学术系统中的一个根本性问题，随着研究论文数量的增长，名称消歧面临越来越大的挑战。针对这一现实世界中的难题，我们提出了 WhoIsWho，它是一个超过 1,000,000 篇论文的大规模基准，采用交互式注释过程构建，具有包括综合任务在内的常规排行榜，以及易于使用的工具包，其中包括整个流程和用于解决任务的最强大的特征和基线模型。我们开发了一个强大的基线模型，并已在 AMiner 系统中部署在线，以支持日常学术研究。
tldr: WhoIsWho是一个大规模的基准，采用交互式注释过程构建，包括综合任务在内的常规排行榜，以及易于使用的工具包，我们开发了一个强大的基线模型，并已在AMiner系统中部署在线，以支持日常学术研究。
en_tdlr: WhoIsWho is a large-scale benchmark with over 1,000,000 papers built using interactive annotation process, having regular leaderboard with comprehensive tasks, and an easy-to-use toolkit encapsulating entire pipeline and most powerful baseline models, our developed strong baseline is already deployed online in AMiner system to enable daily academic research.
